alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 2:18PM MST until February 28 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Fremont County in central Wyoming... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 217 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Red Canyon, or 15 miles south of Lander, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 28 over South Pass will see dangerous conditions due to this snow squall. Locations impacted include... Red Canyon, Fiddlers Lake, Christina Lake, Louis Lake, Frye Lake, Upper Silas Lake, Sinks Canyon State Park, Atlantic City and Sinks Canyon Campground. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
